bio:
Served developers at Microsoft & Twilio. Organize 
CascadiaJS. Angel Investor & building 200okVC.
CEO & Co-Founder @ Major League Hacking (MLH), Investment Partner @ The Community Fund. Forbes 30 Under 30.
Lifelong polyglot developer.  Created Keen.io and ran it for 6 years.  Early investor in 10+ companies, including Stream, Rainforest QA, and Testlio.  Managing Partner at Root System.

Diego Oppenheimer is co-founder and CEO of Algorithmia, the enterprise MLOps platform, where he helps organizations scale and achieve their full potential through machine learning.  Diego is active in AI/ML communities and works with leaders to define ML industry standards and best practices. He brings his passion for data from his time at Microsoft where he shipped some of Microsoft‚Äôs most used data analysis products including Excel, Power Pivot, SQL Server, and Power BI. Diego holds a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems and a Masters degree in Business Intelligence and Data Analytics from Carnegie Mellon University.
Building bridges between developer marketing and revenue for companies big and small. Currently Sr. Director of Developer Marketing @auth0, formerly @twilio. Run Dev/Marketing LLC consulting.

I was an early employee at Twilio, where I spent 8 years building and growing products that developers love. Now I am an angel investor, advisor, and Chief Executive Dog Walker to Scout üê∂ & Walter üêï. I love creating tools and products the enable developers to create something new and unexpected.
üí∏ Investor (B2B SaaS RevOps), üìà 1st sales hire at Apptentive ($100K to $10M+ ARR), ü§ù community builder, ü•É whisky collector.
Product person for many years across the US, UK and Ireland.
Co-founder at Major League Hacking. Previously served developers at Twilio and StartupBus
VP, Developer Network at Twilio. Angel Investor.
7+ years @ Twilio, currently Director of Developer Content. Full Stack Python creator (250k dev readers per month). vim+tmux+Python+(Django|Flask).

Product @ Twilio (communications, telecom, apis, platforms, developers <3). Ex-sales (B2B SaaS/CPaaS commercial,mid-market,enterprise). Lets talk product market fit, building a sales motion and recruiting your best people!
Currently helping to build a platform to provide leverage and agility to 150 data scientists at StitchFix. Previously built developer oriented products at Twilio.
Lead GitHub Education, business school grad, former Research Intern at the MIT Media Lab. Left-handed. Libra.
Product and engineering leader @ Twilio. 1x Founder. Startup advisor & angel investor. Dad jokes.

Today: PM, Machine Learning @ Twilio. Mentor @ Latitud.

Yesterday: Launched + PMM'd a contact center product (Twilio Flex). Previously founded a company doing low-level WebRTC things.
Enchanting technical customers is my jam. Great products don't just have users, they have raving fans. I've enjoyed building & scaling delightful developer experiences at Twilio & Keen IO.

Career as a Dev, Data Engineer, Dev Evangelist, and Product Manager.
Founder at a MarTech platform, acquired.
Founder at an Engineering TeamOps platform.
Angel and mentor at many startups in Seattle and international.
Helping tech/prod orgs to scale. Chief Technology Officer at Checkout.com, ex CTO at Twilio, Skype.
Developer Evangelism and Community at Twilio since 2014. Live in Brooklyn. Dad. Photographer. Chess player.

Long time CRM, call center/telephony, API platforms vet.   Angel investing since 2011.  I like emerging markets - especially those that build property/credit/social impact.  AngelPad alum, and Ondeck Angel fellow.
One of the first engineers at GitHub. Advised GitLab, StackShare, and others. Angel investor and syndicate lead for Xubbers (current and former GitHub employees).

Martin Gontovnikas, a.k.a Gonto, is a software engineer at heart that moved to the ‚Äúdark side‚Äù. Gonto was SVP of Marketing and Growth at Auth0, and now advises companies on their GTM strategy as part of Hypergrowth Partners. With this career transition, he found a way to combine his 2 passions by applying his ‚Äúengineering thinking‚Äù model to Marketing.

You can follow him on Twitter (@mgonto) or read his (not so frequent) blog posts on gon.to
Built+Led DevRel/Community teams w/ co's like SendGrid, Keen IO, DigitalOcean. Mentor, Advisor, Board Member for startups + non-profits globally.
Engineering leadership at Stripe.  Previously co-founder / CTO at Apptentive, mobile at Microsoft, and other adventures.
Building developer and low-code focused products at Twilio.

Head of Developer Experience at Temporal.io. Ex AWS and Netlify. Ran community for >200k devs at /r/reactjs and took Svelte Society from 0 to 10k. Personal blogging reaching ~1m unique visitors a year.
